meanings.definition: Turning or spiraling to the right.
meanings.sent1: The dextrorse staircase led us up to the top floor.
meanings.sent2: The vine grew in a dextrorse pattern around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The dextrorse path through the maze made it easier to find the exit.
meanings.sent4: Her dextrorse thinking always led her to logical conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The dextrorse motion of the tornado was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.sent1: He preferred using his dextrorse hand for writing.
meanings.sent2: The clock's dextrorse movement indicated it was time to go.
meanings.sent3: The dextrorse turning of the doorknob confused the cat trying to open the door.
meanings.sent4: Her dextrorse approach to problem-solving always worked efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The dextrorse rotation of the Earth determines our day and night cycle.
